abstract: Petition meant to protest cuts in aid to New York City's schools is revised by Bloomberg administration to seek end of rule protecting teachers with most seniority in event of layoffs; move draws rebuke from special investigators for city school system, who says it is inappropriate and in violation of state's Constitution.
snippet: A petition meant to protest cuts in school aid was revised to seek the end of job protection based on teacher seniority.
lead_paragraph: A petition meant to protest cuts in school aid was revised to seek the end of job protection based on teacher seniority.

headline.main: Inquiry Faults City’s Insertion of Political View in Parents’ Petition Over School Cuts
headline.print_headline: Inquiry Faults City’s Insertion of Political View in Parents’ Petition Over School Cuts
headline.seo: Revision of New Yorkers’ Petition for Teachers’ Jobs Is Criticized
